page.title: 18Landscape around Brafferton
page.content: The river Skerne follows an 'L'-shaped course through the area, draining the wet and marshy land to the east of the village. One particular field has the unusual feature of four rivulets rising in it and flowing in four different directions. One writer observed "Pity that such a singular close does not exist in the East.There it would have established in the East. There it would have established the fame of some geographical speculator and fixed the site of Eden at once." The river Skerne did also encourage economic activity in the area. In 1857 not only was a water corn mill in operation but a shoe-thread manufactory employing some 60 work people.
